Description:
*RELOCATION OPPORTUNITY* This international business within the luxury Watch, time pieces and accessories sector is looking for a Watchmaker, in their workshops in one of their flagship stores.This brand is steeped with heritage but still pride themselves on innovation & design in the market today. The business is part of a wider group which offers the manufacturing and sale of finished jewellery, watches and accessories across the world.The roles and responsibilities of this WatchmakerTo service and repair watches
To have a full service of products when required
Have direct client interaction.
To provide the highest quality service to ensure perfect technical functioning of the product.
Keep record of all work undertaken on Repair Sheet
Ensure the first level repair quality control according to Group’s recommendations.Skills
Skills:
You must be organized and self-manage workflow while working to targets.
Carry out interventions on watches according to the Group standards.
Inform administration of all additionally required spare parts and details needed.
Working to fast paced yet realistic work timescales.
Have worked in a similar commercial or retail environment.
Have worked with premium or successful timepieces and watches.
WOSTEP/BHI certification – desirable
The benefits of this Watchmaker opportunity –

The brand offers a warm and friendly environment.
Competitive salary
£3600 for relocation expenses which can be claimed back from the company
Bonus potential of £3,000
flexible working patterns
Holidays.
